channel.title: Krystian Safjan's Blog - Krystian Safjan
channel.description:
Data Scientist | Researcher | Team Leader

working at Ernst & Young and writing about Data Science and Visualization, on Machine Learning, Deep Learning and NLP. There are also some howto posts on tools and workflows.

item.title: Working Faster with Git Worktrees and AI-Based Multi-Workflow Development
item.description: A practical, hands-on guide to turning a single codebase into a multi-workflow environment using Git worktrees, VS Code, and AI coding assistants. The tutorial shows how to isolate experiments, compare results, and speed up refactoring work with agents and Copilot.
item.dc:creator: Krystian Safjan
item.category: git, worktrees, ai-coding, refactoring, workflows, vscode, productivity

item.title: Using Git Worktrees as Clean Rooms for AI-Assisted Coding
item.description: Learn how Git worktrees create isolated environments for AI-assisted coding, allowing you to keep your main development line clean while experimenting with AI suggestions in dedicated branches.
item.dc:creator: Krystian Safjan

item.title: Avoiding Homebrew Upgrades That Require Sudo on macOS
item.description: Learn how to manage Homebrew upgrades on macOS to avoid sudo prompts, by differentiating between formulae and casks and using specific commands like --formula, --cask, and pinning problematic packages.
item.dc:creator: Krystian Safjan

item.title: Understanding Python Protocols - Structural Subtyping in Practice
item.description: Learn how Python protocols using structural subtyping in PEP 544 allow for flexible, decoupled code by defining shapes through method signatures rather than class inheritance. Explore examples of implementing read-only attributes and optional methods within protocols.
item.dc:creator: Krystian Safjan

item.title: Evolution of Type Hints in Python — From Comments to Inline Typing and Beyond
item.description: Learn about the evolution of type hints in Python, from initial comments to modern inline typing and key features introduced in each major version, enabling powerful static type checking with tools like mypy and pyright.
item.dc:creator: Krystian Safjan

item.title: Keeping performance results in a separate Git branch using `git checkout --orphan`
item.description: Learn how to use git checkout --orphan to create a separate Git branch with no history, ideal for storing performance results or other generated content independently from your codebase. Discover the process and benefits of using orphan branches, including an example GitHub Actions workflow for publishing test results.
item.dc:creator: Krystian Safjan

item.title: Understanding the Language Server Protocol through a Minimal Working Example
item.description: Learn how the Language Server Protocol standardizes communication between code editors and language servers, enabling editors like VS Code to request features such as diagnostics and completions from a single server, simplifying development workflows.
item.dc:creator: Krystian Safjan
item.category: language-server-protocol, vscode, lsp, developer-tools, editors, programming

item.title: Using CSS Variables for Dynamic and Reusable Styling
item.description: Learn how to use CSS variables for dynamic and reusable styling, enabling features like interactive UIs, easy theming, and design consistency across components. Discover practical usage examples and best practices while understanding limitations and browser support issues.
item.dc:creator: Krystian Safjan

item.title: Bare Asterisk in Python Function Signatures - Keyword Only Arguments
item.description: Learn how to use the bare asterisk in Python function signatures to enforce keyword-only arguments, enhancing clarity and preventing argument order bugs in your code.
item.dc:creator: Krystian Safjan

item.title: Six Weeks, Real Progress - Exploring Shape Up for Product Work
item.description: Shape Up offers a focused alternative to sprint-driven development, trading constant ceremonies and tight iterations for clear boundaries and six-week cycles. This article explores when it works well, when it doesn’t, and why it may help teams overwhelmed by process overhead.
item.dc:creator: Krystian Safjan
item.category: agile, scrum, shape-up, basecamp, 37-signals, shape-up-method, six-week-cycles, product-development-process, agile-alternatives, autonomous-teams, shaping-phase, delivery-rhythm, software-process-design, software-development

item.title: Simpler Parallelism with concurrent.futures
item.description: Learn how to simplify parallel and concurrent programming in Python using concurrent.futures, including executors for managing threads and processes, and futures for handling task results.
item.dc:creator: Krystian Safjan
item.category: python, concurrency, parallelism, threading, multiprocessing, performance

item.title: Threading vs Multiprocessing in Python - GIL Implications and Choosing the Right Tool
item.description: Learn about the Global Interpreter Lock (GIL) and how threading and multiprocessing in Python differ, with examples showing that multiprocessing is better for CPU-bound tasks due to GIL limitations.
item.dc:creator: Krystian Safjan
item.category: python, threading, multiprocessing, gil, concurrency, parallelism, performance

item.title: asyncio Basics - async/await and When to Actually Use Them
item.description: Learn how async/await enables efficient concurrent programming by handling I/O waits without blocking, and discover various ways to run tasks concurrently, manage context managers, and handle timeouts.
item.dc:creator: Krystian Safjan
item.category: python, asyncio, concurrency, async-await, io-bound, performance

item.title: Replacing Makefile with Invoke for Cross-Platform Python Tasks
item.description: Learn how switching from Make to Invoke improves cross-platform compatibility for Python project tasks, ensuring consistent behavior across macOS, Linux, and Windows.
item.dc:creator: Krystian Safjan

item.title: Using OpenAI Python SDK with Local Ollama Models (and When to Opt for Alternatives)
item.description: Learn how to use the official openai Python package with local Ollama models and when it's better to opt for LiteLLM as a more unified alternative.
item.dc:creator: Krystian Safjan

item.title: Building a Multi-Notebook Report with Quarto
item.description: Learn how to split a large Jupyter notebook into multiple notebooks and combine them into a cohesive report using Quarto's book project functionality for HTML, PDF, or EPUB formats.
item.dc:creator: Krystian Safjan

item.title: Downgrade or Upgrade Your Python Version with uv
item.description: Learn how to downgrade or upgrade your project’s Python version using the uv tool, including steps for installing, pinning, and recreating your virtual environment.
item.dc:creator: Krystian Safjan

item.title: Beyond Coverage - Building Truly Complete Test Suites with GitHub Copilot
item.description: This article explores how to move beyond simplistic code coverage metrics to build truly comprehensive test suites using GitHub Copilot. Drawing from practical experience, I demonstrate how AI-assisted testing can identify behavioral gaps, validate API contracts, generate maintainable tests, and address flaky tests - ultimately creating a sustainable quality assurance strategy focused on behaviors rather than coverage percentages. Learn specific techniques for behavioral auditing, integration testing, and continuous quality monitoring that have transformed our approach to software reliability.
item.dc:creator: Krystian Safjan

item.title: Understanding Python's `copy` vs `deepcopy` - When to Use Each
item.description: Learn when to use copy.copy() for shallow copying and copy.deepcopy() for deep copying in Python, understanding their differences and typical use cases.
item.dc:creator: Krystian Safjan

item.title: Tracking Down zsh Alias Plugin Sources
item.description: Learn how to trace and identify the source of zsh aliases defined by plugins using verbose tracing and grep, enabling you to pinpoint exactly where custom aliases are created.
item.dc:creator: Krystian Safjan

item.title: Guide to Managing VS Code Keyboard Shortcuts
item.description: Learn how VS Code handles context-dependent keyboard shortcuts, resolve conflicts using the Keyboard Shortcuts editor, and customize them for efficient coding.
item.dc:creator: Krystian Safjan

item.title: Simple In-Memory Knowledge Graphs for Quick Graph Querying
item.description: As developers, we often reach for full-scale graph databases when simpler solutions would suffice. When your knowledge graph is modest in size, keeping it in memory can be both efficient and practical. Let's explore some powerful tools that make this approach work beautifully.
item.dc:creator: Krystian Safjan

item.title: Quick Ways to Disable GitHub Actions Workflows Without Deletion
item.description: Learn three quick methods to temporarily disable GitHub Actions workflows without deleting them, including commenting out code, using manual triggers, and adding conditional logic.
item.dc:creator: Krystian Safjan

item.title: Pandas Categorical - Benefits and Use Cases
item.description: Learn about the memory efficiency, improved performance, meaningful order, type safety, and faster groupby operations with pandas Categorical data type, especially beneficial for large datasets with limited unique values.
item.dc:creator: Krystian Safjan

item.title: Audio Notifications in Jupyter Notebooks Across Platforms
item.description: Learn how to implement sound notifications in Jupyter notebooks using the cross-platform beepy package and native macOS commands like say and afplay for enhanced productivity.
item.dc:creator: Krystian Safjan

item.title: Notes on using ripgrep for projects with python, jupyter (ipynb) notebooks and markdown files
item.description: Learn how to effectively use ripgrep (rg) for searching Python, Jupyter notebook (.ipynb), and Markdown (.md) files with various options like file type specificity, context display, and pattern matching.
item.dc:creator: Krystian Safjan

item.title: VSCode problem - import could not be resolved from the source (Pylance)
item.description: Learn how to resolve the "Import 'pandas' could not be resolved from the source" warning in VSCode's Jupyter notebook using Pylance by ensuring the correct Python interpreter and virtual environment are activated.
item.dc:creator: Krystian Safjan

item.title: How to Remove Diacritics and Sanitize Strings in Python
item.description: Learn how to easily remove diacritics and sanitize strings in Python using the unidecode library, enabling better search functionality and data normalization for international text.
item.dc:creator: Krystian Safjan

item.title: Implementing Sentence Boundary Detection in Python for Improved Text Chunking
item.description: Learn how to implement sentence boundary detection using spaCy in Python, including handling edge cases and preprocessing techniques for more accurate text chunking.
item.dc:creator: Krystian Safjan

item.title: Bash Parameter Expansion With Default Value
item.description: Learn how to use bash parameter expansion with default values to handle unset or null variables, improve script robustness, and enhance readability through various examples and use cases.
item.dc:creator: Krystian Safjan

item.title: Rss Traffic Analysis for a Blog
item.description: Learn how to track traffic from RSS/Atom feeds using UTM parameters, Google Analytics, dedicated feed analytics services, and server logs to gain insights into your blog's feed consumption.
item.dc:creator: Krystian Safjan

item.title: Borda Count vs. Reciprocal Rank - Choosing the Right Ranking Method for Your Data
item.description: Learn about Borda Count and Reciprocal Rank methods for combining rankings, understanding their key differences in approach and sensitivity to item positions. Discover when each method is more suitable based on specific use cases.
item.dc:creator: Krystian Safjan

item.title: RankFlow plot for retriever visual evaluation
item.description: RAG systems depend on high-quality retrieval to surface relevant information. Analyzing how document rankings evolve through multiple re-ranking steps is complex. This article explores ways to collect ranking data and visualize rank changes to optimize retriever effectiveness.
item.dc:creator: Krystian Safjan

item.title: Best Small Models for Fine Tuning
item.description: Learn about the top small models for fine-tuning, including rankings and insights from a webinar on optimizing open-source large language models to rival GPT-4.
item.dc:creator: Krystian Safjan

item.title: How does QLoRA works?
item.description: QLoRA (Quantized Low-Rank Adaptation) enables efficient fine-tuning of large language models using a 4-bit quantized base model and trainable low-rank adapters, significantly reducing memory usage while maintaining performance. Key techniques include 4-bit NormalFloat quantization, paged optimizers, and double quantization.
item.dc:creator: Krystian Safjan

item.title: How to Check Latest Version of Python Package?
item.description: Learn how to check the latest version of a Python package using pip's new command, PyPI API with curl and jq, or the yolk package, each method offering different levels of convenience and speed.
item.dc:creator: Krystian Safjan

item.title: How to Create Animated Gif From Matplotlib Plot in Python?
item.description: Learn how to create an animated GIF from a Matplotlib plot in Python by generating frames of a sine wave with varying frequencies and saving them as an animated GIF using Pillow.
item.dc:creator: Krystian Safjan

item.title: Remove Noise From Screen Recording
item.description: Learn how to remove noise from screen recordings using FFmpeg and Audacity, or explore free alternatives like DaVinci Resolve, Kdenlive, and Olive Video Editor for effective audio cleaning.
item.dc:creator: Krystian Safjan

item.title: Measuring Quality and Quantity of Unit Tests in Python Projects - Advanced Strategies
item.description: Learn advanced strategies for measuring the quality and quantity of unit tests in Python projects, including metrics like mutation testing, cyclomatic complexity coverage, test smell detection, and more.
item.dc:creator: Krystian Safjan

item.title: Improving Code Maintainability - When to Use Standalone Functions Over Static Methods in Python
item.description: In Python, use standalone functions over static methods when functionality is independent of classes to improve code organization, reuse, testing, and maintainability.
item.dc:creator: Krystian Safjan

item.title: Mastering kwargs in Python - Best Practices for Experienced Developers
item.description: Learn best practices for using **kwargs in Python, including maintaining code clarity, avoiding typos, and ensuring robustness, to help you write more idiomatic and secure Python code.
item.dc:creator: Krystian Safjan

item.title: How to add HuggingFace model to ollama
item.description: Learn how to download and integrate HuggingFace language models into Ollama by creating a modelfile with specific parameters and running the model using the Ollama command.
item.dc:creator: Krystian Safjan

item.title: RAGAS metrics cheat sheet
item.description: Learn about RAGAS metrics, including their descriptions and required input data, to quickly assess model performance. Find the cheat sheet in PDF or JPG format for easy reference.
item.dc:creator: Krystian Safjan

item.title: Use Decouple With Pydantic or Python Dataclass to Manage Configuration in Python App
item.description: Learn how to use python-decouple with Pydantic or dataclasses for managing configuration in Python applications, including basic setup and advantages of using these tools.
item.dc:creator: Krystian Safjan

item.title: OSI Approved in license metadata for Python project
item.description: Learn how specifying an OSI Approved license in your Python project's pyproject.toml file ensures clarity on terms of use, compliance with open-source standards, and reflects your commitment to the open-source community.
item.dc:creator: Krystian Safjan

item.title: GitHub - Troubleshooting 'Permission to repo.git denied to user'
item.description: Learn how to resolve 'Permission to repo.git denied' errors by managing SSH keys in Git for users dealing with multiple GitHub accounts. Discover the causes and solutions involving ssh-agent commands like ssh-add -D and key-specific removals.
item.dc:creator: Krystian Safjan

item.title: Open Source LLM Observability Tools and Platforms
item.description: Managing and monitoring the complex behavior of Large Language Models (LLMs) becomes increasingly crucial. LLMOps and LLM Observability provide essential tools for understanding and controlling these models, ensuring their safe and effective deployment. This article looks into the critical aspects of LLM Observability in the realm of generative AI.
item.dc:creator: Krystian Safjan

item.title: The Most Powerful Mac Productivity and Automation Apps
item.description: Learn about 12 powerful Mac apps for boosting productivity, automating tasks, organizing your desktop, and enhancing your workflow, including Alfred, BetterTouchTool, Hazel, Keyboard Maestro, and more.
item.dc:creator: Krystian Safjan

item.title: Avoid using curl -u “username:secret”!
item.description: Learn how storing credentials in the .netrc file securely manages Basic Authentication with curl, enhancing both efficiency and security compared to using -u username:password.
item.dc:creator: Krystian Safjan

item.title: HTML5 interactive elements
item.description: Learn about HTML5's interactive elements like <details>, <summary>, and <dialog> to enhance web content interactivity without complex JavaScript, plus see practical examples.
item.dc:creator: Krystian Safjan

item.title: entr - run arbitrary command when files change
item.description: Learn how to use entr to automate tasks by running commands when files change, ideal for developers during the coding process. Discover its key features and usage examples for streamlining development workflows.
item.dc:creator: Krystian Safjan

item.title: Tverski Similarity Metrics
item.description: Learn about Tversky similarity, a metric for comparing sets used in information retrieval and recommendation systems, which balances precision and recall through parameters α and β. Understand its formula and see a Python implementation example.
item.dc:creator: Krystian Safjan

item.title: GitHub Search Techniques
item.description: Learn how to effectively use GitHub's advanced search features, including searching by name, description, README, topic, organization, license, stars, date, forks, language, and last push, to find the exact repositories you need.
item.dc:creator: Krystian Safjan

item.title: Databricks Curriculum - From Zero to Hero
item.description: Learn from scratch to become proficient in Databricks by understanding its basics, setting up the environment, grasping Apache Spark fundamentals, and performing basic data processing tasks.
item.dc:creator: Krystian Safjan

item.title: Databricks - key concepts
item.description: Learn about key concepts of Databricks, including its workspace, runtime, file system, clusters, notebooks, jobs, and tables, to understand how they support collaborative data engineering and analytics.
item.dc:creator: Krystian Safjan

item.title: Semantic Type Detection
item.description: Semantic type detection in tables helps understand content for applications like data discovery and validation by labeling columns with standardized types, enhancing machine learning models' performance and facilitating data integration.
item.dc:creator: Krystian Safjan

item.title: Table Representation Learning
item.description: Learn how table representation learning enhances understanding and utilization of tabular data through column embeddings and semantic detection, improving applications like data discovery and validation.
item.dc:creator: Krystian Safjan

item.title: Using Mermaid Diagrams in Pelican Blog Post
item.description: Learn how to embed Mermaid diagrams in your Pelican blog posts using HTML code or a markdown extension, enhancing visual explanations of processes and systems.
item.dc:creator: Krystian Safjan

item.title: Store Output of the Command Into Array in Bash
item.description: Learn how to store directory names from a specified folder into an array using the read -r -d $'\0' command in Bash, ensuring proper handling of special characters and whitespace.
item.dc:creator: Krystian Safjan

item.title: The Importance of Adding a `py.typed` File to Your Typed Package
item.description: Learn why and how to add a py.typed file to your Python package for proper type checking with tools like mypy. Discover the steps to integrate this file using poetry or setup.py and understand its importance for accurate package distribution.
item.dc:creator: Krystian Safjan

item.title: In the Python project made with Poetry shall I add poetry.lock to the git repo or ignore it?
item.description: In a Python project using Poetry, adding poetry.lock to your Git repository ensures consistent dependency versions across all environments. Also include pyproject.toml for project metadata and clarity on dependencies.
item.dc:creator: Krystian Safjan

item.title: Git change remote origin (replace with new)
item.description: Learn how to replace the remote origin in Git with a new URL, covering steps to verify existing remotes, remove the old one, add a new remote, and push branches to the updated remote.
item.dc:creator: Krystian Safjan

item.title: SPLADE sparse vectors - explaination, properties
item.description: SPLADE learns query/document sparse expansion using BERT's MLM head and sparse regularization, offering efficient use of inverted indices, explicit lexical matches, and interpretability while excelling in generalizing to out-of-domain data.
item.dc:creator: Krystian Safjan

item.title: TF-IDF with examples
item.description: Learn how TF-IDF calculates the importance of a word in a document and why rare words are given more weight than common ones. Explore examples to understand term frequency and inverse document frequency metrics.
item.dc:creator: Krystian Safjan

item.title: Growth Hacking Methodology
item.description: Learn about Growth Hacking, a strategy focused on rapid business growth through creative, low-cost experiments and data-driven decisions in marketing and product development. Discover key tactics like experimentation, customer retention strategies, and viral loops used by startups and small businesses for significant growth.
item.dc:creator: Krystian Safjan

item.title: Product Led Growth
item.description: Product Led Growth (PLG) focuses on using a user-friendly product to drive acquisition and expansion, relying on features that encourage self-service, viral growth, and data-driven improvements. Readers will learn how PLG companies prioritize user experience, freemium models, and customer success to achieve organic growth.
item.dc:creator: Krystian Safjan

item.title: RAG-Fusion - Enhancing Information Retrieval in Large Language Models
item.description: Learn about RAG-fusion, a technique that generates multiple query versions from user input and re-ranks them to enhance information retrieval in Large Language Models, providing more relevant responses.
item.dc:creator: Krystian Safjan

item.title: What Is the Key Difference Between PCA and SVD?
item.description: Learn about Principal Component Analysis (PCA) and Singular Value Decomposition (SVD), understanding their differences in application, matrix operations, and computational efficiency.
item.dc:creator: Krystian Safjan

item.title: Choosing technology for the LLM knowledge graph
item.description: Learn about three key technologies—RDF, Graph Databases, and Triplestores—for implementing knowledge graphs, each offering unique advantages in flexibility, efficiency, and specialized RDF data handling.
item.dc:creator: Krystian Safjan

item.title: Prompt Discovery
item.description: Learn prompt discovery to uncover the most effective prompts and combinations thereof to achieve specific tasks, while also considering factors like response quality, model performance, and computational efficiency
item.dc:creator: Krystian Safjan

item.title: Techniques to Boost RAG Performance in Production
item.description: This article discusses several advanced techniques that can be applied at different stages of the RAG pipeline to enhance its performance in a production setting.
item.dc:creator: Krystian Safjan

item.title: Python Expertise Level - Self-Assessment
item.description: Learn to assess your or a candidate's level of Python expertise by understanding the key skills and knowledge required for beginners, advanced programmers, and experts.
item.dc:creator: Krystian Safjan

item.title: Understanding the Differences in Language Models - Transformers vs. Markov Models
item.description: This article explores distinguishing details of Markov Models and Transformer-based models like GPT, focusing on how they predict the next character in a sequence. It explores the fundamental differences between these models, with a particular emphasis on how the self-attention mechanism in Transformer models makes a difference compared to the fixed context length in Markov models.
item.dc:creator: Krystian Safjan

item.title: How Agile Can Kill Creativity in Data Science team?
item.description: Discover the delicate balance between Agile methodologies and imagination in the domain of data science and analytics. Uncover the impact of Agile approaches on creativity within data science teams. Explore how these practices shape the innovative landscape of data science and analytics.
item.dc:creator: Krystian Safjan

item.title: The Right Way to Job-Hop
item.description: Learn how to job-hop effectively by gaining varied experience, staying at each role for a minimum of a year, and always moving up professionally—plus tips on preparing for interviews and understanding the impact on your resume.
item.dc:creator: Krystian Safjan

item.title: LangChain RecursiveCharacterTextSplitter - Split by Tokens instead of characters
item.description: Learn how to use LangChain's RecursiveCharacterTextSplitter to split text into chunks based on tokens, suitable for LLM context limits, and discover the steps to implement this in your natural language processing tasks.
item.dc:creator: Krystian Safjan

item.title: From Fixed-Size to NLP Chunking - A Deep Dive into Text Chunking Techniques
item.description: Discover text chunking - the secret sauce behind accurate search results and smarter language models! By understanding how to effectively chunk text, we can improve the way we index documents, handle user queries, and utilize search results. Ready to uncover the secrets of text chunking?
item.dc:creator: Krystian Safjan

item.title: Criticism of the Lean Startup
item.description: The Lean Startup method remains valuable but faces criticisms such as oversimplification, overemphasis on MVPs, bias towards tech startups, market saturation, and challenges in applying it across different industries. Readers will learn about these critiques and the evolving nature of startup methodologies.
item.dc:creator: Krystian Safjan

item.title: Design Thinking
item.description: Design thinking is an innovative approach emphasizing empathy, creativity, and iteration to solve complex problems and develop user-centric solutions, applicable across various industries for effective product development.
item.dc:creator: Krystian Safjan

item.title: Problems with Langchain and how to minimize their impact
item.description: Beyond the Hype - LangChain's Hidden Flaws and How to Master AI Development.
item.dc:creator: Krystian Safjan

item.title: Jaro-Winkler Similarity
item.description: Learn about Jaro-Winkler similarity, a string-matching algorithm that emphasizes common prefixes and how to implement it in Python, providing better performance for strings with shared beginnings.
item.dc:creator: Krystian Safjan

item.title: Bearer Token Authentication for API
item.description: Learn about bearer token authentication for API security, including how it works, its benefits, and key considerations for implementation and security.
item.dc:creator: Krystian Safjan

item.title: Understanding Retrieval-Augmented Generation (RAG) empowering LLMs
item.description: Understand innovative artificial intelligence framework that empower large language models (LLMs) by anchoring them to external knowledge sources with accurate, current information.
item.dc:creator: Krystian Safjan

item.title: Cookiecutter alternatives
item.description: Learn about alternative scaffolding tools to Cookiecutter, including Yeoman, Hygen, Plop, Slush, SAO, Jolt, and Boilr, each suited for different project needs such as rapid prototyping, large-scale projects, and advanced file processing.
item.dc:creator: Krystian Safjan

item.title: Create Self-Hosted Python Package Repository - General Guide
item.description: Create a self-hosted Python package repository using tools like Devpi or Artifactory to manage and distribute Python packages privately or publicly without relying on external services. Learn how to set up, configure, and upload packages in this general guide.
item.dc:creator: Krystian Safjan

item.title: Lesser-known Python Package Repository Managers
item.description: Learn about lesser-known Python package repository managers like Warehouse, pypiserver, Bandersnatch, and EggBasket, each offering unique features for hosting private packages or mirroring PyPI.
item.dc:creator: Krystian Safjan

item.title: Split glued or joined words
item.description: Learn how to split glued words using the wordninja and wordsegment packages, with examples in Python code for both library usage and command-line interface.
item.dc:creator: Krystian Safjan

item.title: Storing Private Python Packages with Local NAS and Lightweight Servers
item.description: Learn how to store private Python packages on a local NAS using simple file system repositories or lightweight PyPI servers like pypiserver, suitable for small teams and personal projects with basic package management features.
item.dc:creator: Krystian Safjan

item.title: Prompt Discovery in the Context of Large Language Models (LLMs) and Prompt Engineering
item.description: Learn about prompt discovery in large language models, including technical aspects like prompt formulation, semantic representation, and permutations to optimize model responses for accuracy and relevance.
item.dc:creator: Krystian Safjan

item.title: Azure OpenAI Langchain configuration
item.description: Learn how to configure LangChain to use Azure OpenAI by setting up environment variables and initializing the AzureOpenAI model, including a sample code snippet for reference.
item.dc:creator: Krystian Safjan

item.title: Rank Fusion Algorithms - From Simple to Advanced
item.description: Learn about rank fusion algorithms, starting from the simple Borda method and progressing to advanced techniques like LambdaMART and neural rank fusion, to improve combined ranking reliability.
item.dc:creator: Krystian Safjan

item.title: Implementing Reciprocal Rank Fusion (RRF) in Python
item.description: Learn how to implement Reciprocal Rank Fusion (RRF) in Python for combining multiple ranking models to improve information retrieval performance, focusing on collecting reciprocal rank scores and merging them effectively.
item.dc:creator: Krystian Safjan

item.title: gitignore-style exclusion for restic
item.description: Learn how to use .gitignore-style exclusion patterns with Restic by creating a .resticignore file to ignore specific files and directories during backups.
item.dc:creator: Krystian Safjan

item.title: Location of Python Virtual Environments - Choosing Between Project-Folder and Centralized Folder
item.description: Learn about two methods for managing Python virtual environments—project-folder and centralized approaches—and discover their respective benefits in terms of project organization and maintenance.
item.dc:creator: Krystian Safjan

item.title: Cookiecutters for the python package with poetry
item.description: Learn how to use Cookiecutter and Poetry to streamline Python project setup, leveraging pre-configured templates and efficient dependency management for a faster development cycle.
item.dc:creator: Krystian Safjan

item.title: Simplifying Data Download from Google Drive in Google Colab Using gdown
item.description: Learn how to easily download files from Google Drive to your Google Colab notebook using the 'gdown' library, simplifying the file access process for machine learning and data analysis tasks.
item.dc:creator: Krystian Safjan

item.title: Add VSCode to PATH
item.description: Learn how to resolve the "command not found" error for VSCode by adding the code command to your system PATH.
item.dc:creator: Krystian Safjan

item.title: What is downstream task
item.description: Learn about downstream tasks in data science workflows, covering steps from model deployment to decision making and performance monitoring.
item.dc:creator: Krystian Safjan

item.title: Alternatives for Building Python CLI Apps
item.description: Discover the best tools and frameworks for building Python CLI apps. Explore Click, argparse, Typer, and more. Master the art of command-line application development.
item.dc:creator: Krystian Safjan

item.title: Creating a PowerPoint Presentation with a Language Model
item.description: Learn how to generate a PowerPoint presentation using the OpenAI Azure API and Python, including setting up prerequisites, authenticating with the API, and generating an outline with ChatGPT.
item.dc:creator: Krystian Safjan
